name: Heisenbrush (continuous)
author: Arianna
long_description:
This brush blends artistic expression with quantum physics by simulating how quantum spins evolve in the Heisenberg model. When you paint a stroke, your selected color is converted into quantum angles, and each point on the path becomes part of a simulated quantum system.

As the brush moves, a quantum circuit models the magnetization of this system over timeâ€”how the spins of quantum particles align or shift. This magnetization data is then used to gradually modify your original colorâ€™s Hue, Lightness, and Saturation, producing a smooth, evolving color effect along the stroke.

The Strength setting controls how much the quantum-evolved colors influence your base color. At low strength, the original color dominates; at high strength, the quantum behavior takes over, leading to unexpected color transformations.

 -The stroke path and brush radius determine how many qubits are simulated. 
 -The Heisenberg model evolves these qubits over multiple time steps. 
 -The mean magnetization is measured and mapped back into visual color changes.
